Q: How can I keep paint off my carpet when painting my baseboards?
O: (A) Roll out 2-in. wide packing tape so its upper edge rests about 20 in. above the carpeting on the baseboard. The tape should rest lightly on the baseboard so it doesn’t adhere. Then tuck this edge down behind the carpet edge, first with your fingers, then with a wide putty knife. Remove the tape carefully after the paint dries. (B) Roll out 2-in. wide packing tape so its upper edge rests about 1/2 in. above the carpeting on the baseboard. The tape should rest lightly on the baseboard so it doesn’t adhere. Then tuck this edge down behind the carpet edge, first with your fingers, then with a wide putty knife. Remove the tape carefully after the paint dries.

Question: Remove corn husk easily.
Choices: (A) Freeze corn before removing. (B) Microwave corn before removing.

Freezing the corn before removing the husk helps to loosen the husk from the corn, making it easier to remove. When the corn is frozen, the moisture inside the husk turns into ice, causing the husk to contract and separate from the corn. This makes it easier to peel off the husk without damaging the corn. Q: how to wrap soap
O: (A) Cut a sheet of plastic wrap 3 times larger than your soap. Set the soap on top of the waxed paper set on burlap cloth. Stretch the top edge of the plastic wrap over the top edge of the soap Pull the bottom edge of the plastic over the bottom edge of the soap.Bring the left and right sides of the plastic wrap over the soap. Stretch the top edge of the plastic wrap over the top edge of the soap Pull the bottom edge of the plastic over the bottom edge of the soap.Bring the left and right sides of the plastic wrap over the soap. Secure the side edges with a piece of tape or a label.

Q: Make cauliflower cheese casserole
O: (A) 1¾ lbs cauliflower    1 lb broccoli, frozen or fresh    7 oz. cream cheese    1 cup heavy whipping cream    2 cups shredded cheese    2 oz. butter    2 tsp garlic powder    salt and pepper    Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).    Cut broccoli into florets and place in a pot. Add water until covered and bring to a boil. Cook until the broccoli is fork tender.    When done, strain and discard the broccoli. Add cream cheese, heavy whipping cream, salt, pepper and garlic powder. (B) 1¾ lbs cauliflower    1 lb broccoli, frozen or fresh    7 oz. cream cheese    1 cup heavy whipping cream    2 cups shredded cheese    2 oz. butter    2 tsp garlic powder    salt and pepper    Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).    Cut broccoli into florets and place in a pot. Add water until covered and bring to a boil. Cook until the broccoli is fork tender.    When done, strain and discard the water. Add cream cheese, heavy whipping cream, salt, pepper and garlic powder.

Q: how to make spiced rum balls
O: (A) Mix 3 3/4 cups crushed vanilla wafer cookies, 1 1/2 cups confectioners’ sugar, 3/4 teaspoon each nutmeg and cinnamon, and 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger.
